Instructions: Please answer as many of these questions as you can, and mail it to us.

Birthplace: Germany

1. INTRODUCTORY QUESTIONS
   What year did you start housekeeping in Western Canada? 1963

17. Give a typical day's menu (breakfast, dinner and supper) for the earliest year you can remember. Give the year and list the members of the family with their ages at the time. State the approximate month, e.g., winter or summer, and the season, e.g., harvest.

June 1910 - coffee, bread, butter, cooking
May 1915 - meat, potatoes, gravy...much a pudding
November 1918 - brown milk, hard potatoes, no meat allowed
sometimes - brown milk, hard butter, cornbread
Spring lunch - other bread, butter, meat or pancakes on
supper - waffles with cream or syrup

19. Were you ever reduced to almost starvation level living on one or two locally produced foods? Give details.

The hardest up we ever were was in 1932.
We had quite a lot of fruit but had only bread
to eat for part of the winter. In fact
in 1932 we only had $6.00 live on
from December until April 1st. This
had to keep us over. We had lots of
raeplemier, rhubarb and some potatoes.
